paragraph.paragraph:
This sample builds on tutorial
/libraries/wel/samples/tutorial/step5/index.xml step 5 by preventing the loss of the drawing when Windows re-draws the client area of the ../../../reference/windows/wel_frame_window_chart.xmlWEL_FRAME_WINDOW. The output is shown below:
paragraph.heading: 2Compiling

list.item: Choose Open Project from the File menu.
Navigate to <Eiffel_ENViSioN!_installation_path>\compiler\examples\(.net version)\wel\step6\ and select tutorial_step6.eifp
Clicking open loads the selected project
Select Use existing Ace (control file) and click OK
Choose the directory where the project will be compiled, by default the same directory containing the Ace file.

paragraph.heading: 2Running
paragraph.paragraph: After launching the sample, you will see a ../../../reference/windows/wel_frame_window_chart.xmlWEL_FRAME_WINDOW displayed. By holding down the left mouse button, and moving the mouse (Within the client area of the window), you will be able to draw on the client are of the window. If you press the right mouse button, a ../../../reference/windows/wel_modal_dialog_chart.xmlWEL_MODAL_DIALOG will pop up which allows you to enter the thickness of the line that is drawn. If you re-size the window, then the drawing will be re-drawn.
paragraph.heading: 2Under the Hood
paragraph.paragraph:
This system uses a redefined on_paint to re-draw the contents of the window. A LINKED_LIST of LINES is used to store all the lines that have been drawn and during on_paint, this list is traversed in order to re-draw each line. This sample contains the following classes:
TUTORIAL_STEP6
MAIN_WINDOW
LINE_THICKNESS_DIALOG_CHART
APPLICATION_IDS
POINT
LINE
